intro: Nemophila atomaria var. oculata, commonly known as the "Eye-shaped Blue-eyed Mary," is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sun, often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
